page.title: 11The Anchor and the Sweetshop
page.content: {Mrs Wheat}owns the{Anchor}restaurant The busiest time is from April to October.She gets 300 people a day.Her favourite meal is cheese and egg and she doesn't like meat.The building is very old.Alfred Lord Tennyson used to live there.It has been a shoe shop.It has been called several names such as Tennyson Villa, Mermaid Tearoom, Tricky's Pantry, Food for Thought and The Anchor. { {Jan's }sweetshop is owned by{Mr and {Mrs Carter}who used to live in Scunthorpe.The most popular sweet he sells is Extra Strong Mints and his own favourite is chocolate and his wife likes liquorice eclaires.They have worked in Sutton for 4 years and they prefer the summer months to the winter.They like getting satisfied customers.}
